dcterms:description: OPENDRIVE is a road network format used for simulating urban driving scenarios, providing essential data for constructing scenario seed corpora in autonomous driving systems testing.
dcterms:title: OPENDRIVE

dcterms:description: CARLA is an open-source urban driving simulator that provides a platform for testing and developing autonomous driving systems under various conditions.

dcterms:description: Drivefuzz is a methodology for discovering bugs in autonomous driving systems through driving quality-guided fuzzing, generating test scenarios based on random selections within a map.
dcterms:title: Drivefuzz

dcterms:creator: Autoware Foundation
dcterms:description: Autoware is an open-source software project for autonomous driving, providing a comprehensive platform for developing and testing autonomous vehicle technologies.
dcterms:title: Autoware

dcterms:description: LGSVL is a high-fidelity simulator for autonomous driving, designed to provide realistic testing environments for autonomous vehicle systems.
dcterms:title: LGSVL

dcterms:creator: Eric Stafford
dcterms:description: The NHTSA Report connects numerous crashes with driver-assistance technologies, providing insights into the safety implications of these systems.
dcterms:title: NHTSA Report

dcterms:creator: CARLA Team
dcterms:description: The CARLA Leaderboard provides a platform for evaluating and comparing the performance of autonomous driving systems in various scenarios.
